A user manual which describes the use of the XChat-GNOME IRC client.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application is an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) program for the GNOME desktop.

listitem.para: Notification Area Icon Plugin
Direct Client-To-Client (DCC) Transfers
Direct Client-To-Client (DCC) Chats
Adherence to GNOME Human Interface Guidelines (HIG)

note.para: Please note that this project is quite young, at the moment it is not extremely trivial to build, run or debug.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para:
Choose
Internet XChat-GNOME IRC Chat .
To start &app; from a command line, type xchat-gnome, then press Return:

tip.para: To view other command line options that are available, type xchat-gnome --help, then press Return

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, display area, and scrollbars. Menubar contains IRC, Edit, Network, Discussion, Go, and Help menus.

sect2.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to use in &app;.
The Server Pane shows the Servers and Channels currently connected.
The User Pane shows the users present in the selected Channel.
The Discussion Area presents the discussion occurring in the selected Channel.

sect2.title: To Connect to an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) Server
sect2.para:
To connect to an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) Server, choose
IRC Connect . The Connect dialog is displayed. Select the Server that you wish to connect to, then click Connect.

sect2.title: To View Direct Client-To-Client (DCC) File Transfers Information
sect2.para:
To view Direct Client-To-Client (DCC) file transfer information, choose
IRC File Transfers .

sect2.title: To Edit Text
sect2.para: You can edit text in the following ways:

listitem.para: To delete the selected text from the file and move the selected text to a buffer, choose Edit Cut .
To copy the selected text to a buffer, choose Edit Copy .
To insert the contents of the buffer at the cursor position, choose Edit Paste . You must cut or copy text before you can paste text into the file.
To clear all text from the Discussion Area for the currently selected Channel, choose Edit Clear.

sect2.title: To Reconnect A Internet Relay Chat (IRC) Server
sect2.para:
To reconnect &app; to an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server, choose
Network Reconnect .

sect2.title: To Disconnect From An Internet Relay Chat (IRC) Server
sect2.para:
To disconnect &app; from an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server, choose
Network Disconnect .

sect2.title: To Save A Channel Transcript
sect2.para:
To save a transcript of a Channel, choose
Ctrl S
Discussion Save Transcript .

note.para: This feature has not been implemented yet.

sect2.title: To Leave A Channel
sect2.para:
To leave a Channel, choose
Ctrl Q
Discussion Leave .

sect2.title: To Close A Channel
sect2.para:
To close a Channel, choose
Ctrl W
Discussion Close .

listitem.para:
To view previous channel, choose
Alt Up
Go Previous Discussion

To view next channel, choose
Alt Down
Go Next Discussion

To view previous server, choose
Ctrl Up
Go Previous Network

To view next server, choose
Ctrl Down
Go Next Network

sect2.title: To Quit &app;
sect2.para:
To quit &app;, choose
Ctrl Q
IRC Quit .

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para:
To modify the preferences of &app;, choose
Edit Preferences . The Preferences dialog contains the following sections:

listitem.para: Enter the Nickname you wish to use in the Internet Relay Chat (IRC) channel.
Enter your Real Name, which is displayed on /whois requests.
Enter the Quit Message you wish to be shown when leaving an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) channel.
TODO: Need to write Part Message.
Enter the Away Message you wish to be shown when you are away.
TODO: Needs to be written.
Select the Use System Terminal Font option to use the same fonts as your system terminal.
Select the Use this font option to open the Font Selection dialog box.
Select the Show colors option to enable color nicknames in discussion area.
Select the Show timestamps option to show timestamps of discussion.
Use the Built-in schemes drop-down box to specify how &app; should display the text and backgroud color. Select one of the following options:
Use the Black on White option to provide black text on a white background.
Use the White on Black option to provide white text on a black background.
Use the Custom option to create a custom color scheme.

note.para: The following options are only able to be changed if Built-in schemes is set to Custom.

listitem.para: Click on the Foreground mark button to display the color selector dialog. Select the forground mark color for the &app; discussion area.
Click on the Background mark button to display the color selector dialog. Select the background mark color for the &app; discussion area.
Select the buttons of the colors that you wish to change, to display the color selector dialog.

note.para: The colors are only able to be changed if Built-in schemes is set to Custom.

listitem.para: Selct the buttons of the colors that you wish to change, to display the color selector dialog.

note.para: The colors are only able to be changed if Built-in schemes is set to Custom.

listitem.para: Use the Download file to button to select the folder where you wish to download file.
Use the Move completed files to button to select the folder where you wish for completed downloads to be moved.
Select Convert spaces to underscore in filenames if you wish to have spaces converted to underscores in the filename.
Select Save senders nickname in filenames to add the senders nickname to the downloaded file name.
Select the Auto-accept DCC Chat option to automatically accept Direct Client-to-Client (DCC) chats.
Select the Auto-accept DCC File Transfers option to automatically accept Direct Client-to-Client (DCC) file transfers.
Select the Get IP Address From Server option to use your providers DNS to resolve an IP address.
Select the Use This IP Address option and enter your IP address, to use a static IP address.
Use the Individual send KB/s spin box to set your individual maximum upload speed.
Use the Global send KB/s spin box to set your global maximum upload speed.
Use the Individual receive KB/s spin box to set your individual maximum download speed.
Use the Global receive KB/s spin box to set your global maximum download speed.
To add an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server, click the Add button to open the Network Properties dialog.
To edit an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server, click the Edit button to open the Network Properties dialog.
To remove an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server, click the Remove button.
To enable or disable a plugin or script, select the Enable option next to the appropriate item.
To add a new plugin or script, click the Open button to open the file open dialog.
To remove a plugin or script, select the appropriate item and click on the Remove buton .

sect1.title: Network Properties
sect1.para: The Network Properties dialog for &app;, allows you to set the properties for an Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server, and contains the following tabs:

listitem.para: Enter the Name for the Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server.
Select the Automatically connect to network option to connect to a network when starting &app;.
Select the Use secure connection (SSL) option to connect with Secure Socket Layer (SSL).
Select the Cycle until connected option to continue attempts to connect to network, until successful.
Use the Character encoding drop-down box to specify which character encoding &app; should use.
Enter the Server Password, if the Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server requires it.
Select the Use global user settings option to use the global settings used in the General section of .
Select the Use the user settings option to set the Nick name and Real Name specific to this Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server.
Click the Add button to add a new channel.
Click the Edit button to edit the selected channel.
Click the Remove button to remove the selected channel.

note.para: The channel name should begin with a pound sign (#).

listitem.para: Click the Add button to add a new Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server.
Click the Edit button to edit the selected Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server.
Click the Remove button to remove the selected Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server.
